7641738:
bronchoscopy note - [REDACTED]

pt [REDACTED] mrn [REDACTED] is a 59yo female here for bronch w EBUS staging and robotic biopsy of a 34.7mm LUL nodule that was part-solid on CT, bronchus sign was positive, PET showed SUV 12.7.

under general we did linear EBUS first using the Fujifilm EB-580S scope with 21g needle and sampled stations 7 x2, 11R x4, 11L x4, ROSE was there and showed Atypical cells at multiple stations.

then switched to Ion robot and navigated to the LUL superior lingula (B4) lesion, registration was 2.5mm which is fine, got radial EBUS showing adjacent view and did tool in lesion confirmation with radial ebus. took 5 forceps bx, 3 needle passes, brushings x2, BAL sent for cultures.

ROSE from the nodule was Suspicious for malignancy.

no bleeding no ptx   patient did well

specimens to path for cyto, surgical path, cell block, flow, molecular if needed

d/c home after recovery with standard precautions, f/u 1-2wks for path

Steven Park md
ip attending
